text: Rodney David "Rod" Driver (July 1, 1932 - January 16, 2022) was an American mathematician and politician. He was known for research on differential equations. He was a Democratic member of the Rhode Island House of Representatives from 1987 until 1995 and again from 2009 until 2011. Driver was born in London, England. Driver was a professor of mathematics at the University of Rhode Island. Driver died on January 16, 2022 at a nursing home in East Greenwich, Rhode Island at the age of 89. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2022 deaths Category:State legislators of the United States Category:American mathematicians Category:Academics from Rhode Island Category:Scientists from London Category:Scientists from Rhode Island Category:Politicians from Rhode Island Category:Writers from London Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Rod Driver
